description.narrative: Enabling transboundary cooperation and integrated water resources management (IWRM) in the Dniester River Basin (GEF PIMS 5269)

participating-org.narrative: Org. for Sec and Coop in Europ

description.narrative:
Component 1 1.1 TDA completed and agreed by Moldova and Ukraine 1.2 Scenarios and methodologies for predicting ‘water futures’ available to basin stakeholders 1.3 Local strategy for adaptation to climate change developed
Component 2 2.1 Strengthen bilateral bodies 2.2 SAP Endorsed by high-level representatives from Moldova and Ukraine 2.3 Increase in stakeholder involvement in water governance/management and awareness 2.4 Number of lessons/experiences disseminated (documenting also gender mainstreaming experience 2.5 Number of national stakeholders trained
Component 3 3.1 Establishment of framework for flood early warning and forecasting 3.2 Agreement on data exchanges and monitoring with Improvements on hydro-met services 3.3 Implementation of pilot demonstration project 3.4 Increased availability of basin-wide information 3.5 Project website functional and number of visits 3.6 Participation in GEF IW Conference and IW:LEARN exchanges

comment.narrative: - Regional collaboration in adjacent water bodies (e.g. through the ICPDR) established - EU Association Agreements signed by Moldova/Ukraine promote use of IWRM approaches - Diagnostic Analysis and River Basin Management Plan (RBMP) exist partly for Moldova only. No TDA and SAP for the two riparians - Stakeholder involvement in water governance/management is average - Unresolved issues btw water, environment and hydropower sectors - Currently no regular meeting of the recently established Dniester Commission - No international flood early warning system available - No documents / TORs for significant technical projects on adaptation to climate change at local level in the Ukrainian part of the Dniester basin

Component 1 1.1 Transboundary Diagnostic Analysis (TDA) further developed, discussed with stakeholders and ready for approval 1.2 Testing of water balance system completed Component 2 2.1 Strengthening bilateral Dniester Commission by conducting bilateral meetings of the Dniester Commission working groups workshops and trainings 2.2 Preparation of the Strategic Action Plan 2.3 Consultation workshops with local stakeholders 2.3 Organizing “Dniester Day 2019” and “Dniester Summer School” Component 3 3.1 Preparing assessment of areas with risk of flooding 3.3 Implementation of two (2) pilot demonstration projects kept on track 3.5 Functional project website / website of the Dniester commission further maintained and updated

Component 1 - Draft TDA prepared and presented at the Dniester commission meeting in April 2019 as well as three thematic reports: on the impact of the Dniester hydroelectric system, inventory of tailings, and the economic assessment of environmental services - A seminar on the current state of tailing mines and their potential impact organized - Sampling points for water, sediments and biota for screening have been identified by the two countries Component 2 - Action plans of the Dniester Commission’s working groups for 2019 were approved - The second meeting of the bilateral Dniester Commission organized in April 2019 - A training on water balance system organized in April 2019 - Working group meetings organized – The meeting of the working group on ecosystems and biodiversity was held on 22 – 23 July in Zalishchyky, Ukraine/ The meeting of the working group on emergency situations was held on 22 July in Chisinau, Moldova / The meeting of the Moldovan part of the working group on the planning and management of the river basin was held on 26 July. - Support provided for award ceremony from International Basin Contest “Colours of the Dniester-2018” - Support provided for the next Contest “Colours of the Dniester 2019” - Dniester Day 2019 was held on 26 May in Vadul-lui-Voda, Moldova. The event was co-organized by the Austrian Development Agency, the GEF Dniester Project and UNDP Moldova. - Dniester summer school for 77 young people from both banks of the Dniester (4 – 14 July), an expedition on kayaks Dniester-2019 with the participation of 35 students and journalists (5 – 11 July) was organized by the NGO Eco-TIRAS, with partial support from the Dniester GEF project - An interim assessment of the implementation of the GEF project for the period from May 2017 to April 2019 was carried out by an independent expert – see https://dniester-commission.com - A study tour took place in the Goulburn and Brocken river basins (Murray sub-basins, Australia). More about the trip at https://dniester-commission.com. - Representatives of water companies of the two countries took part in the 17th International Conference “EUROPE-INBO” on 17 – 20 June 2019 in Lahti, Finland. - Representatives of the Goulburn-Broken Catchment Management Authorities (the Murray-Darling river sub-basin, Australia) visited the Dniester River basin from Ivano-Frankivsk to Odesa - Component 3 - Preliminary assessment of areas under flood risk completed, including mapping, data collection on rivers and floodplains in the area of Opir, Bystrica, the Bystrica-Nadvirnyanska, the Bystica-Solotvinska and Kuchurgan rivers - As part of a transboundary pilot project to improve knowledge and bilateral cooperation on fish resources in the Lower Dniester, fish larvae were selected to determine their spawning sites, and a variety of rare and invasive species and amateur fishing were monitored by expert groups from Moldova (including Transdnistria region of Moldova) and Ukraine. - As part of the pilot project for the restoration of the Yagorlyk River, a field study was conducted with the participation of the Iberian Center for River Restoration, and a discussion was held on the strategy of the pilot project with representatives of the local people, the administration of Okniansk united territorial community and Okniansk district.Input to the Dniester Commission website provided

Component 1 1.1Transboundary Diagnostic Analysis (TDA) further developed, discussed with stakeholders and ready for approval 1.2 further work on the water balance system 1.3 Situation analysis for adaptation to climate change development Component 2 2.1 Strengthening bilateral Dniester Commission by conducting bilateral meetings of the Dniester Commission and organizing at least 3 working groups workshops and at least 3 trainings 2.2 Further work on the Strategic Action Plan 2.3 Consultation workshops with local stakeholders 2.3 Organizing “Dniester Day 2020” and “Dniester Summer School” Component 3 3.1 Preparing assessment of areas with risk of flooding 3.3 Implementation of two (2) pilot demonstration projects kept on track 3.5 Functional project website / website of the Dniester commission further maintained and updated

Component 1 - The final version of the TDA / part 1 of the transboundary RBMP of the Dniester River is posted at the website of the Dniester Commission https://dniester-commission.com/en/news/the-transboundary-diagnostic-analysis-for-the-dniester-river-basin-issued/. - The web-based system for calculating the water balance was improved by the project team of experts transferred for joint use to the water agencies of the two states (March 2020); - Summary of a large-scale inventory of 31 tailing storage facilities (TSF) in the Dniester River Basin has been published - https://dniester-commission.com/en/news/large-scale-study-on-the-state-of-tailings-storage-facilities-in-the-dniester-basin/. Implementation of the summary-based recommendations was discussed with the Head of the Verkhovna Rada Committee for Environmental Policy and Environmental Management, as well as with the heads of the Lviv and Ivano-Frankivsk regional administrations. - The “Analysis of the goals, limitations, and opportunities for optimizing the regime of spring ecological reproductive release from the Dniester reservoir” (hydrological part) was published – please see https://dniester-commission.com/en/news/the-experts-examined-optimization-options-for-spring-ecological-reproductive-release-from-the-dniester-reservoir/. Component 2 - The draft Strategic Action Programme posted online for public consultation at https://dniester-commission.com/en/news/discussion-of-the-strategic-action-programme-for-the-dniester-basin/ Comments accepted until 15 October 2020. / SAP submitted for consideration and decision to be signed by the respective ministers of the Republic of Moldova and Ukraine (December). - A press conference on results of a screening (40,000 chemicals in water, sediments and biota) of the Dniester organized on 12 March 2020 http://uacrisis.org/ua/75199-chemical-analysis-of-dnister-and-siversky-donets-osce (available in Ukrainian and English). - Four online meetings of the heads of the Dniester Commission working groups were held (June-July). - Online meetings of two working groups were held: on planning and river basin management (October 23) and on emergency situations (December 10); also, meeting of heads of working groups of the Dniester Commission was held (December 22).
Component 3 - Further progress on implementation of EU Flood Directive - Hydrological calculations carried out for each of the 87 measured cross sections of the channels and adjacent territories of 5 selected sections (Opir, Bystrica, Bystritsa-Nadvirnyanskaya, Bystritsa-Solotvinskaya and Kuchurgan rivers) for hydraulic modeling of the level regime. - Raster maps of a scale of 1: 10000 and 1: 25000 for subbasins of 5 sections on selected rivers for further digitizing of the landscape and for digital modeling of the landscape. - Development of flood hazard maps and flood risk maps for the following extreme hydrological scenarios: 10% of probability (once every 10 years), 1% of probability (once every 100 years), 0.2% of probability (once every 500 years) - - The web-based system for calculating the water balance was improved by the project team of experts transferred for joint use to the water agencies of the two states (March 2020) https://dniester-commission.com/novosti/vodoxozyajstvennyj-balans-bassejna-reki-dnestr/ , - As part of a transboundary demonstration project on fish resources in the Lower Dniester, the identification of fish spawning sites has been completed, a variety of rare and invasive species has been investigated, and the extent of recreational fishing has been assessed. - As part of the demonstration project for the restoration of the Yagorlyk River, the environmental impact assessment (EIA) procedure has been launched (an application is available at http://oknyanska.gromada.org.ua/news/1584629987/)

Component 2 2.1 Supporting bilateral Dniester Commission, Final stakeholder conference 2.2 The Strategic Action Plan endorsed 2.3 Consultation workshops with local stakeholders
Component 3 3.3 Implementation of two (2) pilot demonstration projects 3.5 Functional project website / website of the Dniester commission further maintained and updated
Terminal Evaluation, Narrative and Financial reporting completed

Component 2 - The “Joint Statement on the Strategic Action Program for the Dniester River Basin for 2021-2035” was endorsed on 31 March 2021 by high-level representatives from the two riparian countries - https://dniester-commission.com/novosti/podpisano-sovmestnoe-zayavlenie-o-strategicheskoj-programme-dejstvij-po-bassejnu-reki-dnestr-na-2021-2035-gg/. - Final Stakeholder conference in May 2021 - WMO Hydrology Online Course (April 2021, https://etrp.wmo.int/login/index.php) arranged for 13 participants from the Moldovan and Ukrainian hydrometeorological centers and other relevant institutions, as well as 8 more countries in which they understand Russian (total 30 participants from 10 countries). Component 3 - Demo project “Ecological restoration of the section of the Yagorlyk river from the village Dovzhanka up to the village Rozivka” completed - demo project “Improving knowledge and improving bilateral cooperation on fish in the Lower Dniester” completed
